The Greatest Songs Ever Written (By Us)
White Trash, Two Heebs and a Bean

narrative.narrative:
Let's be honest: 2024 was the year you became THAT NOFX person. You know, the one who played them 13,306 times while everyone else was discovering whatever was trending on TikTok. You spent over 31,000 minutes with Fat Mike and the gang, which is roughly 21 solid days of your life. Some people went on vacation. You went to punk rock summer camp and never left.

You listened to "The Decline" 108 times this year. That's 18 minutes and 8 seconds of political punk rock commentary... times 108. That's 33 hours of one song. You could have watched the entire Lord of the Rings extended trilogy twice and still had time left over. But no, you chose capitalism critique set to power chords, and honestly? Respect.

Your dedication peaked on June 2nd when you played "The Decline" 18 times in a single day. EIGHTEEN TIMES. That's 5 hours and 24 minutes of the same song. Were you okay? Were you studying for a punk rock final exam? Did you lose a bet? Whatever happened that day, you clearly needed Fat Mike to explain socioeconomic collapse on repeat.

But NOFX wasn't your only obsession. Chumbawamba showed up with 3,225 plays, proving you appreciate both anarcho-punk manifestos AND getting knocked down (then getting up again). You also squeezed in 2,770 plays of Screeching Weasel, because apparently your musical palette is "1990s punk rock or nothing."

"Linoleum" was your anthem with 132 plays. You know every word, every guitar riff, every snotty vocal inflection. You probably dream in power chords at this point. And when it was late at night and the world was quiet, what did you reach for? "Linoleum" 43 times after midnight. It's like a lullaby, but for people who think moshing is a valid form of self-expression.

You pulled from 360 different albums but somehow 10 of your top albums were NOFX. Your number one album was literally called "45 or 46 Songs That Weren't Good Enough to Go on Our Other Records," which you played 1,645 times. Even NOFX thinks these songs weren't good enough, but you? You gave them 42 hours of your life anyway. That's punk rock loyalty right there.

Your listening pattern reveals you're either a night owl or a vampire. Peak listening at 1 AM? You racked up over 2,400 plays in the wee hours, probably annoying neighbors or concerning roommates. Mondays were your biggest day, which makes sense because nothing says "I hate capitalism" like starting your work week with bands that literally wrote songs about hating capitalism.

You maintained a 164-day listening streak. That's nearly half the year of consecutive punk rock. You woke up every single day for 164 days and thought, "You know what I need? More power chords." And you were right.

With 30,642 total tracks played across just 74 artists, you're not exploring musical diversity so much as you're digging the deepest possible tunnel into one very specific genre. You listened to music for 78,488 minutes this year. That's 54 and a half days of pure audio. Most people use music as a soundtrack to their life. You used your life as an excuse to listen to more music.

So here's to 2024: the year you proved that you don't need algorithmic recommendations, carefully curated playlists, or trendy discoveries. You need Fat Mike yelling about politics, power chords at 180 BPM, and the unwavering belief that punk's not dead—it's just being played on repeat in your headphones. Same time next year?

personality.tagline: You've listened to NOFX more than Fat Mike has
personality.description: You've achieved what scientists call 'punk rock tunnel vision' - 43% of your entire year was just one band. You've listened to 'The Decline' 108 times, which means you've spent over 33 hours on a single song. That's longer than most people's relationships. Your commitment to NOFX is so intense that the other 74 artists in your library are basically just taking up space between NOFX albums. You peaked at 1 AM because that's when the existential dread hits and only Fat Mike's sarcasm can soothe you. You listened to one song 18 times in a single day, which is either dedication or a cry for help. Your 164-day listening streak suggests you'd rather give up water than give up punk rock.
personality.spirit_animal: A mohawked hamster on a wheel that only spins counterclockwise

roasts: You listened to NOFX 13,306 times this year. Even Fat Mike is calling his therapist asking if this level of devotion is healthy.
You played 'The Decline' 108 times, which means you spent 33.9 HOURS listening to one song. That's longer than some people's entire music libraries.
43% of your entire year was just NOFX. At this point, you're not a fan, you're a tribute band that forgot to learn the instruments.
You listened to an album literally titled 'Songs That Weren't Good Enough' 1,645 times. NOFX warned you and you STILL came back for more.
74 unique artists in 30,642 plays? You've got the musical diversity of a punk rock vending machine that only dispenses one flavor.

aura.description: Your aura radiates pure punk rock devotion—a blistering red energy fueled by 13,000+ NOFX plays and an unshakeable loyalty to Fat Wreck Chords' finest. You're the person who listened to 'The Decline' 108 times because 18 minutes of political punk rock isn't excessive, it's essential. Your late-night anthem is 'Linoleum' at 1 AM, and you've achieved a 164-day listening streak that would make even Fat Mike nod in approval. Your musical soul lives in DIY basements, thrift store band tees, and the belief that the best songs are fast, furious, and sharply satirical. You don't just listen to punk—you breathe it, sleep it, and probably argue about it at 2 AM. Your energy is a mosaic pit at a packed all-ages show: chaotic, communal, and gloriously uncompromising.

superlatives.award: Most Likely to Start a Punk Rock Monopoly
superlatives.reason: NOFX took up 43% of your entire year - that's 13,306 plays. You basically listened to other bands as a palate cleanser between NOFX sessions.

superlatives.award: The '18-Minute Song Isn't Long Enough' Award
superlatives.reason: Played 'The Decline' 108 times for a grand total of 33.9 HOURS of the same song. That's longer than most people's work weeks.
Played 'The Decline' 18 times in a single day on June 2nd. That's 5.4 hours of one song. Either you REALLY love it or you passed out with repeat on.
Your peak listening hour is 1 AM with 'Linoleum' as your late-night anthem (43 plays after midnight). Sleep is for people who don't have 30,642 songs to get through.

superlatives.award: Quality Over Quantity (Just Kidding, You Want Both)
superlatives.reason: Listened to 74 artists but gave NOFX the equivalent attention of 50 of them. Why explore new music when you can explore NOFX's entire discography... repeatedly?

hot_takes: You listened to NOFX for 43% of the entire year. Even Fat Mike is concerned about your wellbeing at this point.
You played 'The Decline' 108 times, which means you spent over 33 HOURS listening to one song. That's not dedication, that's a cry for help.
18 plays of 'The Decline' in a single day is basically a part-time job. Did you take lunch breaks or just power through?
Only 74 unique artists in 30,642 plays? You don't have a music taste, you have a monogamous relationship with 90s pop-punk.
Your Spotify Wrapped would just be NOFX telling you to please, PLEASE listen to literally anyone else for once.

suggestions: You listened to 'The Decline' 18 times in one day and spent 33+ hours on NOFX live albums. In 2025, you're legally obligated to attend a punk show. May I suggest checking out Direct Hit! or The Bombpops for that same chaotic energy?

With 13,306 NOFX plays (43% of your ENTIRE year), you've basically earned a PhD in Fat Mike studies. Time to explore the extended Fat Wreck Chords family: Lagwagon, Strung Out, and No Use for a Name will feel like coming home.
Your 1am peak listening + 43 after-midnight 'Linoleum' spins = certified night owl punk. Feed that vampire schedule with Masked Intruder's pop-punk hooks or The Lillingtons' horror punk vibes.

Chumbawamba (3,225 plays) + Propagandhi (1,904 plays) = you're here for the politics AND the punchlines. 2025 prediction: You'll discover Anti-Flag's deeper cuts and become insufferable about Against Me!'s 'Reinventing Axl Rose' at parties.

You averaged 2,150 minutes of punk rock per month and somehow only listened to 74 artists total. That's not a music library, that's a committed relationship. Branch out with Lifetime, Jawbreaker, or Hot Water Music—same intensity, new heartbreak flavors.
